reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Improving access to prevention and treatment services as well as human rights for key populations in Tunisia

description.narrative: Tunisia - HIV - Office National de la Famille et de la Population de la République de Tunisie - ONFP. This program has the following goals: D’ici 2025, les nouvelles infections à VIH sont réduites d’au moins 50%, en particulier parmi les populations clés et leurs partenaires / By 2025 the new HIV infections are reduced by at least 50% amongst the key populations and their partners. D’ici 2025, la mortalité liée au VIH/sida est réduite de 70% / By 2025 the HIV-related deaths are reduced by 70%'. Les barrières à l'accès aux services du VIH liées aux inégalités à la stigmatisation, aux discrimina-tions, aux normes sociétales de genre et aux violations des droits des PVVIH et populations clés sont levées. / Barriers to accessing HIV services related to inequalities, stigma, discrimination, societal gender norms and violating of key populations’ rights are lifted.. Le leadership national et l’efficience de la gouvernance sont renforcés pour assurer l'accélération et la durabilité de la réponse au VIH d’ici 2025 / By 2025 national leadership and governance efficiency are reinforced to ensure the acceleration and durability of the HIV response.. The objectives of this program are: D’ici 2025, 95% des populations clés et vulnérables (PS, HSH, UDI, détenus et migrants) utilisent le paquet de services de prévention combinée selon des approches différenciées. / By 2025, 95% of the vulnerable and key populations (SW, MSM, IDUs, detainees and migrants) use the combined prevention service package based on differentiated approaches.. En 2025, les approches différenciées de prévention sont développées auprès des femmes et des hommes issues des autres populations vulnérables avec l’implication des acteurs communautaires. / In 2025 differentiated prevention approaches are developed with women and men from other vulnerable populations with the implication of community actors.. D’ici 2025, 90% des PVVIH femmes et hommes connaissant leur statut reçoivent un traitement antirétroviral conforme aux directives nationales. / By 2025, 90% of the PLHIV (men and women) knowing their status receive ART as per national directives.. Les obstacles liés au genre à l’accès aux services VIH sont levés et les politiques nationales sur l’égalité entre les sexes contribuent à réduire les risques et l’impact du VIH parmi les femmes et filles. / The gender-linked barriers to access to HIV services are lifted and national policies on gender equality contribute to reducing risk and HIV impact among women and girls.. Le leadership et la coordination de la réponse nationale au VIH/sida et IST sont assurés efficacement au niveau central. / The HIV and STDs national response leadership and coordination are efficiently assured at the central level'

title.narrative: Impact indicator for TUN-H-ONFP
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Percentage of people who inject drugs who are living with HIV
Coverage / Output indicator for TUN-H-ONFP
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people who inject drugs that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Number of needles and syringes distributed per person who injects drugs per year by needle and syringe programs
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Outcome indicator for TUN-H-ONFP
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of people who inject drugs reporting condom use at last sex
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
HIV O-Other 3: % of female and male sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
HIV O-Other 2: % of adults and children who are still on treatment after 6 months, 1, 2, 3, 5 years from the initiation of treatment
HIV O-Other 1: % of injecting drug users reporting the use of sterile injecting equipment the last time they injected
Percentage of people who inject drugs reporting the use of sterile injecting equipment the last time they injected
